label: 奏
本: The Emergence of Japanese Kingship . Stanford University Press . 1997
説明文: An oral or written memorial to the throne from a bureaucratic agency, minister, or official. There were, for instance, Daijōkansō, memorials sent by the Council of State to the tennō. Their content was to reflect the consensus of opinion of the Council. According to the ritsuryō Law on Official Communication (Kushiki-ryō), individual officials could also address suggestions or opinions to the ruler. [太政官奏、天皇、律令、公式令]
